intro: Verbascum aphentulium, commonly known as the narrowleaf mullein, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, velvety leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. Verbascum aphentulium is valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional medicinal uses.
